application_flow.action: Click Apply button on job listing
application_flow.notes: Redirects to Workday login/account creation page
Workday requires account creation. Can sign in with existing account or create new one.
First step in 6-7 step wizard. Resume auto-parse fills subsequent fields after upload.
Auto-populated from resume parse. Review and correct fields: first name, last name, email, phone, address.
Work history section. May be pre-filled from resume parse.
Education history. May be pre-filled from resume parse.
Company-specific questions including work authorization, sponsorship needs, etc.
Review all information and submit application.

quirks.description: Workday requires creating an account before applying. Cannot submit without login.
quirks.workaround: Pre-create a Workday account for Adobe's instance, or use 'Apply with LinkedIn' if available.

quirks.description: Application is a 6-7 step wizard. Each step must be completed before proceeding.
quirks.workaround: Navigate steps sequentially using [data-automation-id] selectors. Wait for each step to fully load.

quirks.description: Workday auto-parses resume and fills fields. Parsed data may be inaccurate.
quirks.workaround: After resume upload, verify all auto-filled fields and correct any errors before proceeding.

quirks.description: Workday uses data-automation-id attributes as stable selectors.
quirks.workaround: Always prefer [data-automation-id='...'] selectors over CSS classes which change between versions.

notes: Adobe uses Workday (wd5 instance). Standard Workday application wizard with resume auto-parse.
